availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John E. McIntire (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and judge)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and judge. Kentucky native. Married to Permelia Anne Johnson McIntire in Washington County, Kentucky, in January 1832. Father of Julia A. McIntire, Ellen Eliza McIntire, Mary C. "Kate" McIntire, and Sarah Louisa McIntire. Married to Ann M. McIntire. Father of Hetty Mary McIntire, Florence L. McIntire, James McIntire, Nancy J. McIntire, and Anna McIntire. Farmer in Washington County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Employed Susan Canary as a seamstress in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Presiding judge of the Washington County Court in 1862. Presiding judge of the Washington County Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 218B-219A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 531.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Springfield, p. 31-32.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862, Legislative Document Series, No. 24 (Frankfort, KY: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 298-306.
"Judge John E 'Jack' McIntire (1812-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #105270911, accessed May 5, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105270911.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film #000551244, p. 325.
